text.textblock: The information will be used to determine if a qualifying dislocation has occurred and to assess an applicant's eligibility for benefits.
Information Collection Requirements for Hazardous Liquid and Carbon Dioxide Pipeline Operators.
Title 49 CFR part 195 prescribes operation and maintenance procedures for hazardous liquid and carbon dioxide pipeline operators.
The information will be used by RSPA and State inspectors to determine operator compliance with pipeline safety standards.
1 hour and 6 minutes reporting; 235 hours recordkeeping.
Recordkeeping Requirements for Gas Pipeline Operators.
Title 49 CFR part 192 prescribes the operation and maintenance procedures for natural and other gas pipeline facilities.
The information will be used by RSPA and State inspectors to evaluate operator compliance with pipeline safety standards.
Alcohol Misuse Prevention Program for Personnel Engaged in Specified Aviation Activities.
The information is needed to respond to regulations promulgated in accordance with the Omnibus Transportation Employee Testing Act of 1991, enacted on October 28, 1991.

The information will be used to monitor industry implementation and compliance with the FAA Alcohol Misuse Prevention Program. The information will also be used to evaluate the effectiveness of the program.
FAA Alcohol Testing MIS Data Collection EZ Form; FAA Alcohol Testing MIS Data Collection Form, DOT Breath Alcohol Testing Form.
